body: OK I think I fixed all code styling issues. I also squashed all commits.

Also for gap gen to cover a building, all its footprint cells must be within range. So if part of the building is outside gap gen range it will appear as normal. Does footprint include bibs, the space below structures?
Shroud is an engine-level feature, so please don't introduce RA-specific logic and naming there.  You can do that instead in the mod-level traits.
Do you mean UpdateShroudGeneration to UpdateGapGeneration etc changes? But it doesn't generate shroud anymore if fog is enabled. Isn't gap a general name for it?
No, shroud is the name for shroud and fog is the name for fog.
OK so how should it be called? It's not a shroud generator or fog generator but a combination of those. ShroudFogGeneration?

Actually if fog is enabled, gap generator doesn't generate fog. The fog is generated automatically by the engine. What gap gen does then is remove frozen actors from fog. So it either generates shroud or removes frozen actors from fog. WHat should it be called? Gap generator seems to be the most appropriate name, it generates a gap in enemy radar/map. Are there any other name suggestions? ShroudFogGeneration doesn't look suitable since gap gen doesn't generate fog.

Also the other point pchote made, I haven't introduced any ra specific code here? The shroud generation code was already there, I just changed its behaviour. And don't all mods have shroud and fog option? So it's not mod specific.

The concept of having the "shroud generation" do one thing if shroud is enabled but another if it isn't is a RA specific idea.  Other mods may want to have pure shroud generators or pure cloak generators, but you are instead enforcing them to do what the gap generator does.

The shroud code needs to keep these ideas separate (with separate methods and state for shroud and cloak generation), and then the gameplay code (i.e. CreatesShroud) should expose trait properties so that the generation type can be configured in the yaml.
OK it was agreed in IRC to call this functionality "Stealth Field Generation". I will make the necessary changes and send another commit.
I decided to postpone this until #7577 and #7560 are merged and #7669 is fixed.

OK, the other PRs that were related to this one are merged so I started working on this again. Has dependencies label can be removed.

Now I have another naming question: So the general trait will be called CreatesStealth, it is a general stealth field. And then there will be two types of stealth. One is the current gap generator, it will generate shroud, so it's called Type: Shroud. But what should the new type be called? The new gap generator behaviour will act as frozen actor remover from fog, prevent units from being auto targeted and also remove satellite icons. Sensor disruptor was suggested in IRC. What do you think?
:-1: for `CreatesStealth`, shroud is not stealth/cloak.

This is basically what I've gathered from all the discussions about how it **should** work when done:
- Working with Shroud disabled - it removes actors frozen under fog
- Working with Fog disabled - it generates shroud
- Working with both Shroud and Fog disabled - ~~it just makes things "invisible" unless you are near them~~ - Or just disallow this option for normal games.
- Working with both Shroud and Fog enabled - removes actors frozen under fog

Yes. Or simpler: if fog is enabled, gap gen acts as disruption generator. If fog is disabled but shroud is enabled, it generates shroud. ~~If both are disabled, it makes units invisible?~~ The option to disable both fog and shroud should be removed?
@Phrohdoh: So what should it be called instead of CreatesStealth.cs?
OK I have updated the code. Another review please.
I have finished the code. It adds a new trait called CreatesDisruptionField. This makes gap gens work without shroud.

This certainly _works_, but...

I do not think this is visually pleasing (structures disappearing into the fog abruptly):
![gif](http://i.imgur.com/5QjbVRX.gif)

This is such a drastic change from the entirety of CnC fog.
With the 3 _modes_ that this supports it will be entirely too difficult to explain / make use of, IMO.

This is also a :-1: with RA2 in mind.
OK but how could it be done otherwise so that gap generators work when shroud is disabled?
This code is still not finished. I found some bugs and am trying to fix them...

This patch has turned out to be more complex than I had thought. Currently it has the following problems:
1) ~~If a previously discovered building that is under active gap gen (disruption field) is sold or destroyed, its frozen actor doesn't reappear if the gap gen is not active anymore. In other words, the information that it is no longer there is revealed, which is not done for normal frozen actors.~~ :white_check_mark: 
2) ~~Whether a frozen actor is rendered or not is decided by using its footprint. But whether it can be auto-targeted is decided by its OccupiedCells(). These are different areas, which results in buildings that are visible as frozen actors but not auto-targeted, if the occupied cells are under disruption field but the bibs of the building (which are part of the footprint) are not.~~ :white_check_mark: 
3) ~~When a move order is given over a hidden frozen actor, it is registered as attack order.~~ :white_check_mark: 
4) GPS icon appears for a moment over frozen actors sometimes.

I am trying to fix these issues but I'm having a hard time. Any help is appreciated.

~~I decided to postpone this PR again. I am stuck at fixing issue 1) described above... pchote said there may be some changes to how frozen actors are rendered. So I am waiting either that to be finished or someone to show me how I could fix these problems.~~

I have fixed the three bugs described above. GPS icon appearing briefly over newly rendered frozen actors is not caused by this PR, it is also present in bleed. See #7920. This PR is now finished and needs review. I tested it and couldn't find any other issues.

I made the changes you requested. While I was doing that I also realized that there should also be a separate RenderDisruptionCircle trait to draw the range circle. And shouldn't this and RenderShroudCircle be in Mods.Common? Or even in the engine itself. Because they are part of CreatesShroud and CreatesDisruptionField traits.

And the developing continues...
[19:54:56] <+pchote> find the thing that calls the render, and then create an actor preview
[19:55:03] <+pchote> and then render that and stash the sprites
[19:55:46] <+pchote> actually, there's a problem there
[19:55:59] <+pchote> the base ActorPreview class currently lives in Mods.Common
[19:56:07] <+pchote> it will need to move into game for you to be able to do this
I have changed this to use ActorPreview for rendering the frozen actor. I also added some checks so that it is only rendered when the building state has changed.
I am closing this in an attempt to clean up the PR queue a bit. Feel free to reopen it once the conceptual problems are cleared up.
This apparently depends on satellite code being fixed to handle visibility and stuff. Related: #8203
